title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.4: Child Survival and Development (CSD) COMMUNITY PROGRAM

description.narrative: By 2018, communities and households in disadvantaged areas in four regions and precarious areas in Abidjan, have appropriate acces to community care and practices for maternal health, newborn and child health, nutrition and Wash, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Health And Emergencies, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Polio Eradication. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: pregnant women, newborn, children and adolescents utilize health services offering both high impact interventions and respectful and quality care and promoting healthy behaviours

description.narrative: In 2020, in the COVID-19 context, the Country Office ensured the continuity of community activities by setting up an online platform to train Community Health Workers (CHWs) and providing them with Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) to safely carry out community interventions in the 24 health districts supported by the Country Office. ; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2021
